node.doctext:
Why did I get downvoted?

Yes, people do occasionally -- (downvote) a node. Their reasons are as [id://20974|varied] as their haircuts, and make about as much sense. The best thing to do is to not get hung up on your nodes' [id://18538|reputation]. Be more concerned about your personal reputation!

Changes in your nodes' reputation can affect your [id://5938|XP]... but again, this barometer of personal worth should not be given too much weight; it's really just a game we play to make life at the Monastery more interesting.

As the nice people at [http://www.everything2.com/|Everything] [http://www.everything2.com/index.pl?node=Voting%2FExperience%20System|have noted]:

[gods|The administration] does not take the voting and experience point system all that seriously.

Woe unto those who do.

XP is an imaginary number granted to you by an anonymous stranger.

Historically, posts complaining about or suggesting radical changes to the [id://5938] are themselves unpopular; most get downvoted and many get [id://409197|reaped].

[tye] has written a nice FAQ-like node which could be (but isn't) entitled [id://590525|Why does it seem like I have an enemy who is systematically downvoting every node I post?]

Back to [PerlMonks FAQ]
node.title: Why did I get downvoted?
